definition: mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: GMO foods do not have to be labeled in America.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，转基因食品毋须用签条标明。

sentences.english: He inserted a slip marking his place in the book.
sentences.chinese: 他在书中插入纸页，以标明他读到的地方。

sentences.english: As its name indicates, Professional wear refers to the garments for professionals.
sentences.chinese: 职业装，顾名思议，就是能够标明职业特征的服装。

sentences.english: Now there are almost four hundred mapped ways to climb Seneca Rocks.
sentences.chinese: 现在已经有地图标明的攀登路线近四百条。

sentences.english: As the map indicates, the Lincoln Park is one of the scenic spots.
sentences.chinese: 按地图上所标明的，林肯公园是风景点之一。

sentences.english: It must be followed by the function name and the parenthesized list of formal parameters.
sentences.chinese: 其后必须带有函数名和以括号标明的参数列表。

sentences.english: If you don't indicate any location, that by default in the production order will be used.
sentences.chinese: 如果你没有标明任何位置，默认这生产单将使用。

sentences.english: Where the indications or the functions marked on the labels of the pharmaceuticals do not fall within the prescribed scope.
sentences.chinese: 标明的适应症或者功能主治超出规定范围的。

sentences.english: But over time our studies indicate, stocks do go up and up.
sentences.chinese: 但是我们的研究标明，股票总体还是会一涨再涨的。

sentences.english: A fence marked the perimeter of the field.
sentences.chinese: 标明了那块田地的周界。

sentences.english: Some quotations seek an author, others lose them.
sentences.chinese: 有些语录标明作者何人，而有些则查无此人。

sentences.english: All lifting appliances must be clearly marked with an identification number and with their safe working loads.
sentences.chinese: 所有起重器具必须清楚标明标识号和其安全作业载荷。

sentences.english: They are usually red, and they display the price per kilometre on the window.
sentences.chinese: 它们一般是红色的，窗上标明了每公里的价格。

sentences.english: The barrel was labelled flour and taken aboard the ship.
sentences.chinese: 那只木桶标明是装的面粉，被运上了船。

sentences.english: The three are being held after crossing an unmarked border on a hike.
sentences.chinese: 三名美国人试图穿越未标明的边境进入伊朗时被拘。

sentences.english: Beijing is indicated on the map by a red star.
sentences.chinese: 在这幅地图上北京是用一颗红星标明的。

definition: to mark out/to tag/to put a sign on sth explaining or calling attention to/to annotate (e.g. a character with its pinyin)
model or template character/written slogan or phrase/mention (e.g. "air mail" 航空 on a letter, "first draft" 初稿 on a document etc)
variant of 標誌|标志[biao1 zhi4]
must/to need to/to be sure to
to ask/to invite/please (do sth)/to treat (to a meal etc)/to request
